page.title: 15Tourism in Newburgh
page.content: Newburgh is a small East coast village.It is quiet and peaceful with lots of things to do.Newburgh is easy to get to either by car or bus.There are two hotels and there is also a caravan site next to one hotel.The nearest railway station is at Aberdeen 12 miles away from Newburgh. Newburgh has a Golf course,a beautiful beach and lots of good places for fishing where salmon and trout are caught.Newburgh has some historic buildings like Knockhall Castle and the Church. Among the facilities for children are 3 playparks and 1 football pitch.There is a public hall where discos and coffee mornings are held.Newburgh has a lot to offer tourists.The scenery in the surrounding countryside is beautiful and all tourists are welcome.The atmosphere is friendly.
